In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **X** serves the following purposes:

- x represents a [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan") or [mythical/fantastic insect](/wiki/Mythical/fantastic_insect "Mythical/fantastic insect"):

  - x [grid bug](/wiki/Grid_bug "Grid bug")
  - x [xan](/wiki/Xan "Xan")

* X represents a [xorn](/wiki/Xorn "Xorn"), which is the only member of the [xorn](/wiki/Xorn_\(monster_class\) "Xorn (monster class)") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class").

- Press [x]() to [swap](/wiki/Swap_weapons "Swap weapons") your primary and secondary weapons.
- Press [shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [x]() to begin [two-weapon combat](/wiki/Two-weapon_combat "Two-weapon combat").
- Press [ctrl](/wiki/Ctrl "Ctrl") + [x]() to display your [base attributes](/wiki/Base_attributes "Base attributes").
- Engrave the character **x** to engrave without breaking [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") [conduct](/wiki/Conduct "Conduct").
- X may also refer to the [X Window System](/wiki/X11 "X11").

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)
  - [2.4 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), the xyloman used the x glyph, while the xerp used the X glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the X glyph is instead given to the xorn, while the xerp is moved to the x glyph. In [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), the xerp is replaced by the xan as the monster using the x glyph.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces additional monsters that use the x glyph:

- x xan or mythical/fantastic insect:

  - x [spark bug](/wiki/Spark_bug "Spark bug")
  - x [arc bug](/wiki/Arc_bug "Arc bug")
  - x [lightning bug](/wiki/Lightning_bug "Lightning bug")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces additional monsters that use the x and X glyphs:

- X xorn:

  - X [bestial dervish](/index.php?title=Bestial_dervish\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Bestial dervish (page does not exist)")
  - X [ethereal dervish](/index.php?title=Ethereal_dervish\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ethereal dervish (page does not exist)")
  - X [xorn monk](/wiki/Xorn_monk "Xorn monk")

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), X is also used to represent [large deep-rock dwellers](/wiki/Large_deep-rock_dweller "Large deep-rock dweller"), which replaces the xorn monster class while using the same macro (**S\_XORN**) to designate them.

The 'new' monsters that use the x and X glyphs are as follows:

- x xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
  - x jitterbug

- X large deep-rock dweller

  - *X* [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") (formerly U)
  - X [ettin](/wiki/Ettin "Ettin") (formerly H)
  - X [deep ettin](/index.php?title=Deep_ettin\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep ettin (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

[SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and introduces additional monsters that use the x and X glyphs, including monsters from the [biodiversity patch](/wiki/Biodiversity_patch "Biodiversity patch"):

- x xan or other mythical/fantastic insect:

  - x [microscopic space fleet](/wiki/Microscopic_space_fleet "Microscopic space fleet")
  - x [gold bug](/wiki/Gold_bug "Gold bug")
  - x [bug](/wiki/Bug "Bug")
  - x [PDP-11](/index.php?title=PDP-11\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "PDP-11 (page does not exist)")
  - x [PDP-9](/index.php?title=PDP-9\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "PDP-9 (page does not exist)")
  - x [heisenbug](/index.php?title=Heisenbug\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Heisenbug (page does not exist)")
  - x [chillbug](/wiki/Chillbug "Chillbug")
  - x[VAX](/wiki/VAX "VAX")
  - x [Cray](/index.php?title=Cray\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Cray (page does not exist)")
  - x [Deep Thought](/index.php?title=Deep_Thought\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Deep Thought (page does not exist)")
  - x [Eddie](/index.php?title=Eddie\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Eddie (page does not exist)")

- X xorn:

  - X [grid xorn](/wiki/Grid_xorn "Grid xorn")
  - X [blemmye](/wiki/Blemmye "Blemmye")
  - X [otyugh](/wiki/Otyugh "Otyugh")
  - X [greater xorn](/index.php?title=Greater_xorn\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Greater xorn (page does not exist)")
  - X [Marvin](/index.php?title=Marvin_\(monster\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Marvin (monster) (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

X

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter X serves the following purposes:

  • x represents a xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
    • x grid bug
    • x xan
  • X represents a xorn, which is the only member of the xorn monster class.
  • Press x to swap your primary and secondary weapons.
  • Press shift + x to begin two-weapon combat.
  • Press ctrl + x to display your base attributes.
  • Engrave the character x to engrave without breaking illiterate conduct.
  • X may also refer to the X Window System.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 NetHack Fourk
    • 2.4 SlashTHEM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, a variant of Jay Fenlason's Hack, the xyloman used the x glyph, while the xerp used the X glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the X glyph is instead given to the xorn, while the xerp is moved to the x glyph. In Hack 1.0, the xerp is replaced by the xan as the monster using the x glyph.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces additional monsters that use the x glyph:

  • x xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
    • x spark bug
    • x arc bug
    • x lightning bug

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces additional monsters that use the x and X glyphs:

  • X xorn:
    • X bestial dervish
    • X ethereal dervish
    • X xorn monk

NetHack Fourk

In NetHack Fourk, X is also used to represent large deep-rock dwellers, which replaces the xorn monster class while using the same macro (S_XORN) to designate them.

The 'new' monsters that use the x and X glyphs are as follows:

  • x xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
    • x jitterbug
  • X large deep-rock dweller
    • X umber hulk (formerly U)
    • X ettin (formerly H)
    • X deep ettin

SlashTHEM

SlashTHEM retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and introduces additional monsters that use the x and X glyphs, including monsters from the biodiversity patch:

  • x xan or other mythical/fantastic insect:
    • x microscopic space fleet
    • x gold bug
    • x bug
    • x PDP-11
    • x PDP-9
    • x heisenbug
    • x chillbug
    • xVAX
    • x Cray
    • x Deep Thought
    • x Eddie
  • X xorn:
    • X grid xorn
    • X blemmye
    • X otyugh
    • X greater xorn
    • X Marvin

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''X''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|x}} represents a [[xan]] or [[mythical/fantastic insect]]:
** {{monsymlink|grid bug}}
** {{monsymlink|xan}}

* {{white|X}} represents a [[xorn]], which is the only member of the [[Xorn (monster class)|xorn]] [[monster class]].

* Press {{kbd|x}} to [[Swap weapons|swap]] your primary and secondary weapons.
* Press {{kbd|shift|x}} to begin [[two-weapon combat]].
* Press {{kbd|ctrl|x}} to display your [[base attributes]].
* Engrave the character '''x''' to engrave without breaking [[illiterate]] [[conduct]].
* X may also refer to the [[X11|X Window System]].

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21, a variant of [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], the xyloman used the {{white|x}} glyph, while the xerp used the {{white|X}} glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the {{white|X}} glyph is instead given to the xorn, while the xerp is moved to the {{white|x}} glyph. In [[Hack 1.0]], the xerp is replaced by the xan as the monster using the {{white|x}} glyph.

==Variants==
===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces additional monsters that use the {{white|x}} glyph:

* {{white|x}} xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
** {{monsymlink|spark bug}}
** {{monsymlink|arc bug}}
** {{monsymlink|lightning bug}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] introduces additional monsters that use the {{white|x}} and {{white|X}} glyphs:

* {{white|X}} xorn:
** {{red|X}} [[bestial dervish]]
** {{brightgreen|X}} [[ethereal dervish]]
** {{orange|X}} [[xorn monk]]

===NetHack Fourk===
In [[NetHack Fourk]], {{white|X}} is also used to represent [[large deep-rock dweller]]s, which replaces the xorn monster class while using the same macro ('''S_XORN''') to designate them.

The 'new' monsters that use the {{white|x}} and {{white|X}} glyphs are as follows:

* {{white|x}} xan or mythical/fantastic insect:
** {{cyan|x}} jitterbug
* {{white|X}} large deep-rock dweller
** {{brown|<u>X</u>}} [[umber hulk]] (formerly {{monsym|umber hulk}})
** {{brightblue|X}} [[ettin]] (formerly {{monsym|ettin}})
** {{magenta|X}} [[deep ettin]] 

===SlashTHEM===
[[SlashTHEM]] retains the monsters added in SLASH'EM and introduces additional monsters that use the {{white|x}} and {{white|X}} glyphs, including monsters from the [[biodiversity patch]]:

* {{white|x}} xan or other mythical/fantastic insect:
** {{cyan|x}} [[microscopic space fleet]]
** {{yellow|x}} [[gold bug]]
** {{brown|x}} [[bug]]
** {{white|x}} [[PDP-11]]
** {{white|x}} [[PDP-9]]
** {{yellow|x}} [[heisenbug]]
** {{brightblue|x}} [[chillbug]]
** {{brightgreen|x}}[[VAX]]
** {{white|x}} [[Cray]]
** {{white|x}} [[Deep Thought]]
** {{magenta|x}} [[Eddie]]
* {{white|X}} xorn:
** {{magenta|X}} [[grid xorn]]
** {{gray|X}} [[blemmye]]
** {{green|X}} [[otyugh]]
** {{red|X}} [[greater xorn]]
** {{brightcyan|X}} [[Marvin (monster)|Marvin]]
{{nethack-367}}
